Job Title: Robotics Engineer

Location: Boulder, CO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Summary

 Job Summary 

The Animal Inspired Movement and Robotics Lab (AIMRL, led by Prof. Kaushik Jayaram) group seeks a postdoctoral researcher with overlapping experience in miniature electronics, embedded programming, and artificial intelligence. A successful candidate must be flexible to ensure meeting deliverables for a fast-paced, deadline-oriented project. The University of Colorado Boulder is committed to building a culturally diverse community of faculty, staff, and students dedicated to contributing to an inclusive campus environment. We are an Equal Opportunity employer, including veterans and individuals with disabilities.

The University of Colorado Boulder is committed to building a culturally diverse community of faculty, staff, and students dedicated to contributing to an inclusive campus environment. We are an Equal Opportunity employer, including veterans and individuals with disabilities.

Who We Are

AIMRL group's research combines biology and robotics to uncover the principles of robustness that make animals so successful at locomotion in natural environments, and, in turn, inspire the design of the next generation of novel robots for effective real-world operation. Specifically, our current work is focused on enhancing autonomy (power, sensing and control) of insect-scale robotic platforms. Our research aims to develop a rich ecosystem of robotic devices that, in the not-so-distant future, will have the potential to benefit human lives in the areas of search and rescue, inspection and maintenance, personal assistance, and environmental monitoring.

Responsibilities

 What Your Key Responsibilities Will Be 

Designing, fabricating, assembling, analyzing, and managing custom electronics solutions for microrobot/biohybrid system actuation, sensing and control.Generating manuscripts.Assisting with project proposals.Oversight of the lab.Student Mentoring.Teaching in Workshops/Outreach activities.Project management.

What You Should Know

This fulltime position is appointed in one-year intervals, with re-appointments anticipated in year 2 (contingent on satisfactory performance and funding).

What We Can Offer

The starting salary for this position will be $60,000 annually.

Benefits

The University of Colorado offers excellent benefits , including medical, dental, retirement, paid time off, tuition benefit and ECO Pass. The University of Colorado Boulder is one of the largest employers in Boulder County and offers an inspiring higher education environment. Learn more about the University of Colorado Boulder .

 Be Statements 

Be curious. Be game-changing. Be Boulder.

What We Require

PhD in Electrical Engineering, Robotics, or closely related field.Expertise in unusual format electronics (large area, distributed, flexible and stretchable) design and fabrication.Expertise in embedded programming.Proficient in Matlab/Python, and other related circuit design tools.

What You Will Need

Excellent writing and communication skills.Independent, collaborative, and motivated.Interest in mentoring graduate and undergraduate students.Ability to work with team members from diverse cultural and scientific backgrounds.

What We Would Like You To Have

Experience with miniature power electronics.Experience with RF communication and energy harvesting.Experience with designing and fabricating custom sensors.Experience with high-voltage actuation technologies such as piezoelectric, dielectric elastomeric actuators, etc.Experience with mechanical CAD.

 Special Instructions 

To Apply, Please Submit The Following Materials

Resume/CVCover LetterReference Letter (Optional) Transcripts/Proof of Degree: If you are selected as the finalist, your degree will be verified by the CU Boulder Campus Human Resources Department using an approved online vendor. However, if your degree was obtained outside of the United States, please submit an English-translated version as an Optional document. 

For full consideration, please apply by May 1, 2024. This position will remain open until filled.

Note: Application materials will not be accepted via email. For consideration, please apply through CU Boulder Jobs .

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
